pros: Amazing leadership - I trust them completely! Truly advancing the Kingdom through excellence in service.
cons: It is located in a small town which may be difficult to adjust to.

pros: Great coworkers and supervisors. Good vacation and holiday.
cons: Low pay and little opportunity to move up.

pros: Friendly and family atmosphere that is comforting.
cons: Low wages and boring duties with no advancement.

pros: Great benefits, excellent atmosphere, awesome people, active in the community, cares for students.
cons: Salary is low for many positions.

job_title: Graduate Assistant Strength & Conditioning Coach in Brownwood, TX
pros: Good experience working with a variety of athletes
cons: Overworked and underpaid for the amount of work

pros: People are very nice and supportive.

job_title: Resident Director and Activities Coordinator in Brownwood, TX
pros: Known, appreciated, supported, spiritual development woven into work.
cons: Small town and cost is something to consider.

pros: Most of the people that work there are good Christian people. And every employee automatically gets like 20 days a year paid off cuz any break the students are outta school for, the employees get off as well and those days are paid...
cons: Very low hourly wages. No raise potential what so ever. Only raises that are ever givin to any employee are cost of living raises. And are only a few cents and ebery employee recieves the same raise. Fell 20ft out of an attic while at work and was on workmans comp for 3 months till i was released by dr. to return to work. A week after returning to work i was asked to resign to avoid bein terminated.

pros: The family atmosphere is what kept me going in college.  This office was so helpful and encouraging.  They were like a second family to me and I already miss them.  This job will help you learn to multitask, as you will be going to school and working.  But they are more than willing to work with your schedule.
cons: It only pays minimum wage which can be a struggle for some college students but you cannot expect more than that at a small private university.  If you are looking for a job that pays more, then I would look off-campus.

review_title: My experience at HPU was good.
pros: Great collegial environment, supportive administration and motivated student body. The opportunity to engage colleagues in research and present publicly is wide open to the creative faculty member.
cons: Salaries are a bit low and the community is isolated. Teaching load can be prohibitive in regards to research. The library is in need of serious investment in terms of resources.

pros: I had my job in the marketing office through work study. My boss was very flexible and let me make my own schedule to fit around my classes.
cons: Work study limited the amount of hours I could work a week. Would have loved to work more while I was in school.

job_title: Public Safety Officer in Brownwood, TX
pros: Excellent hierarchy structure,  the DPS vehicles has a few problems, but when they are running 24 hours a day, that is going to happen. All staff did what they could to maintain them, as well as all other equipment.
cons: Very little funding for DPS, and little to no training. Other than that, there really no cons for this job.

pros:

cons:

pros: Great Campus with beautiful all brick buildings. Good people and faculty that really care about their students.

pros: Short shifts, social environment, flexible schedule, work around classes, middle of campus
